thread.title: Dallas Green gets blue about love
thread.title_full: Dallas Green gets blue about love

title: Dallas Green gets blue about love
text:
Dallas Green on City and Colour’s fifth album and hints at new recording with Pink Kathy McCabe National Music Writer News Corp Australia Network Dallas Green on City and Colour’s fifth album and hints at new recording with Pink Kathy McCabe National Music Writer News Corp Australia Network Love songs ... City and Colour's Dallas Green writes sad tunes for If I Should Go Before You. Picture: Supplied 
DALLAS Green’s wife reminded him to write a love song for his newCity and Colour album. 
So he wrote the truly sad If I Should Go Before You , which is also the title track of City and Colour ’s fifth album You may want to grab a tissue. 
The album opens with the epic Woman which runs for more than nine minutes. Who does that anymore? 
I will be honest with you; we had a 30 minute version. I wasn’t looking to do an epic song, I just wanted to have fun with the band in that very selfish, very self-indulgent way. We started playing a riff and melody and I didn’t want it to stop, I just wanted to go with it but when we went into the studio, I said ‘Let’s get it down to 10 minutes’. It’s fun to play one note for a long time, it’s meditative and I’ve always been a big fan of music like that, stoner rock. Why can’t I have one of those? Writer’s block ... Green fears he’ll never write another song as soon as he finishes one. Picture: Supplied. 
You and the band went into the studio not long after you finished making the You + Me record with Pink . 
Yeah, it wasn’t long after we saw you in LA. You know that every time I write a song, I fear I am never going to write another one. My wife and I moved to Nashville in November and I had a couple of good days just playing guitar and songs starting to take shape. I kept them in the rawest form and brought in the band (Jack Lawrence, Dante Schwebel, Doug MacGregor and Matt Kelly) instead of constructing them alone in the basement. Before I knew it, we had 15 songs. I was so excited about making the record with them. We had toured together for two years and had such a wonderful relationship on and off stage. I figured out the best way to hang out again was to make a record. We brought the tour into the studio which means beers and lots of whisky. There may have been some food here and there.
